revised_title: Magnetic Properties of Dilute Palladium-Iron Alloys
tldr: The authors investigated the magnetic properties of dilute palladium-iron alloys, focusing on the dynamic properties in the ferromagnetic state (spin waves). They used a virtual bound state model and found that the spin wave spectrum has two branches, with one branch having zero frequency in the long wavelength limit. The study also provided a simple relation between the induced giant moment and the susceptibility of the matrix, which is in reasonable agreement with experimental data.
